profiles:
Summary •	Solutions-driven, client-oriented IT professional with over 15 years of leadership experience. 
•	Resourceful and versatile, capable of leveraging a wide range of technology skills to effectively manage organizational change, mitigate risk, infuse new ideas and deliver solutions. 
•	Outstanding relationship builder, skilled at quickly gaining and maintaining the trust and respect of C-level executives, staff and strategic partners.  
•	Solid record of achievement in building and aligning IT function with strategic objectives to achieve dramatic bottom-line results. Specialties:Php, Perl, JavaScript, Ajax, Html, Drupal, WordPress, SQL, DBI/DBD, FileMaker scripting, Progress 4GL, SharePoint, MySQL, FileMaker, Postgres, Sybase, Progress, ODBC, DBI/DBD, LAMP, Apache, IIS6. •	Resourceful and versatile, capable of leveraging a wide range of technology skills to effectively manage organizational change, mitigate risk, infuse new ideas and deliver solutions.

Experience IT/Web Manager Stanford University - Woods Institute for the Environment October 2005  – Present (9 years 11 months) Stanford, CA The institute harnesses the expertise of leading academics and decision-makers, pioneering innovative approaches to meet the environmental challenges of the 21st century – from climate change to sustainable food supplies to ocean conservation. 
 
Responsible for the full IT function of the core institute, its strategic collaborations and affiliated faculty. Primary role is building and maintaining the institute’s websites; building custom web-based tools for managing the institute’s marquis funding programs; building web-based tools to support staff, affiliated organizations and faculty. 
 
•	Engineered and released 4 major and several minor versions of the institute’s website. The website represents the university’s environmental contingent and receives upto 20,000 visits monthly. 
•	Created a custom content management system (CMS) for managing and maintaining the institute’s website. 
•	Collaborated and managed the build of websites for 6 affiliated organizations. 
•	Analyze site analytics to help build search engine optimization (SEO) and guide site enhancements and growth. The site has grown more than 20% annually over last 6 years. 
•	Developed custom systems for managing the full cycle process of several of the institute’s funding programs. These systems manage the application, review, administration, reporting and statistical processing of these funding programs which provide millions of dollars in seed funding to innovative research programs. 
•	Created a custom contact relationship management (CRM) system for the institute to keep track of relationships with policy makers, businesses, NGOs, academic institutes, media outlets. The database system has also been adapted and adopted for use by one of the institute’s affiliated organizations. 
•	Built an Intranet system which includes 2 document management systems, a digital asset management system, collaboration tools and administrative tools. 
•	Created a custom system for managing email campaigns. Director WildTec January 2004  –  January 2010  (6 years 1 month) Not-for-profit organization dedicated to providing technology solutions for international field-based wildlife conservation. 
Principal Technology Consultant  
 
Work with wildlife conservation organizations around the world (remotely and on-site) to plan, design, procure and install custom, secure and sustainable field technology solutions. Vice President of IT Iverson Financial Systems, Inc. January 1996  –  April 2004  (8 years 4 months) Sunnyvale, CA Provider of U.S. and international stock market data and securities services for the investment community and content suppliers. Clients included Morgan Stanley, Schwab, JP Morgan and Bear Stearns. 
 
Built and directed the corporate IT function, supporting (24x7x365) global business operations with remote offices in New York and London. Hired, trained and managed a high-performance staff including software engineers, database developers, systems administrator, operations specialist/Webmaster, and outside consultants.  
 
•	Planned, architected and managed the high-availability (99%) 20-server fault-tolerant LAN/WAN environment. 
•	Headed the analysis, development and maintenance of all browser-based tools. 
•	Instituted corporate IT policies & procedure. 
•	Defined the architecture, built and launched the Global Index Monitor product (GIM) for a high-profile client, later evolving into the firm’s flagship product. GIM attracted new large international investment firms/banking clients and ultimately generated 30% of company revenue. 
•	Built a Short Interest system requiring almost zero maintenance, quickly evolving into the product with the greatest ROI.  
•	Contributed to numerous database upgrades and enhancements improving the Securities History System (SHS). SHS represented 30% of gross revenue.  
•	Designed and launched the first corporate Intranet. Functionality included self-maintenance tools, backup system tools, departmental home pages and documentation.  
•	Constructed a secure corporate data center running an energy solution enabling uninterrupted operation critical systems.  
•	Built and maintained a fault tolerant delivery system hosting more than 500 client hits a day. 
•	Managed IT due-diligence effort in preparation for a successful corporate merger. Retained by the new parent to assist in the smooth transition of all technology. 
•	Member of Board of Directors from 1981 to 2000. Peace Corps Volunteer Peace Corps 1991  –  1995  (4 years) Niger, West Africa Regional Leader / Representative (1994 – 1995) 
Established regional offices supporting 60 agents in 2 geographic regions performing health, agriculture and bio-diversity field work. Arranged and conducted diplomatic tours for domestic and foreign dignitaries. 
 
Field Supervisor / Coordinator – Niger (1993 – 1994) 
Implemented project analysis and goal setting processes in collaboration with Niger government and international organizations to improve regional project execution, efficiency and quality.

•	Collaborated and managed the build of websites for 6 affiliated organizations.

•	Created a custom contact relationship management (CRM) system for the institute to keep track of relationships with policy makers, businesses, NGOs, academic institutes, media outlets. The database system has also been adapted and adopted for use by one of the institute’s affiliated organizations. 
•	Built an Intranet system which includes 2 document management systems, a digital asset management system, collaboration tools and administrative tools. 
•	Created a custom system for managing email campaigns. Summary -Proven ability to lead teams, students and colleagues in and out of the workspace/classroom. 
-Exceptional teacher and mentor, my interns/students/co-workers have gone on to be the best designers and leaders in their field. 
-Over 13 years of design experience developing exceptional interfaces for the web and mobile/tablets. 
-Over 13 years of experience creating meaningful and artful multimedia/video/interactive installations. 
-Ability to plan, execute and manage website and application design projects using effective project management research tools and methods. Strong analytical and problem solving skills; comfortable working as creative director/manager, thought leader, UI guru, developer, marketer and/or designer. Create, build and maintain all 20 websites for the HR Department. 
Responsible for designing and executing creative concepts and art direction and layout in all realms of digital media.

Director of Interactive Media Mount St. Mary's University March 2005  –  February 2006  (1 year) emmitsburg, maryland Design and build new website for the entire college from ground up using HTML, ASP and Ektron CMS. This includes UI navigation and usability testing, creating dynamic forms and an interactive Flash map. Create e-newsletters for all departments on campus. Create graphics for new website and take photos/video. Attend weekly meetings and train interns for web related projects. Work closely with IT to make sure server side databases run smoothly. Webmaster and IT Technician College Misericordia August 2004  –  March 2005  (8 months) dallas, pennsylvania Handle all IT related issues in the library. Perform weekly Backups to the IBM Server in library. Troubleshoot, repair and maintain computing lab. Maintain the library webpage. Teach staff and students basic computing and troubleshooting techniques for Windows XP. Speak with vendors on latest software packages and provide price quotes for latest software for yearly budget. Manage work-study students. Serve on Committees and attend weekly meetings regarding computing issues.(www.misericordia.edu/library) Video Encoder Divx 2003  –  2004  (1 year) san diego, california Decrypt, Encode and QA Films to put online. Use comprehensive database to input content in Access. Deal with content providers and customers daily. Ship out titles to companies. Help develop the Iprism product for constant filtering of sites; which include troubleshooting and re-categorization of the sites filtered. Help department achieve quarterly goals and develop as a team. Summary I’m a digital product designer with 15 years experience in interaction design and digital strategy. I have designed solutions for clients in a range of industries, from financial services to healthcare, insurance, telecommunications and entertainment. I have a proven history of applying user-centered design techniques to complex problem spaces, and balancing user needs with business goals and technical realities. 
 
My recent projects have included enterprise social networks and complex transactional systems, including responsive web and mobile apps, and have used both Agile and waterfall methodologies. 
 
My unusual career path, from scientist to digital product designer, has given me a unique set of skills - including data analysis,web programming, and content management. I understand the needs of the client/product owner and the design and development teams, as I've spent time in each of their positions.  
 
My specialties include:  
* User experience design 
* Digital product strategy 
* User research  
* Product concept testing 
* Prototyping (both paper and interactive) Summary I’m a digital product designer with 15 years experience in interaction design and digital strategy. Summary I am the Director of Web Development working on the online efforts for Desk.com. My professional interests are web project management, social media implementation, content strategy, information architecture, and facilitating communication between clients, end-users, web developers, and vendors. I am very experienced with visual and interface design, wireframing, rapid prototyping, and web usability. I'm also involved in front-end development, technical training, and web application development. Sometimes I even use Drupal or Wordpress to help maintain websites. 
 
Specialties:  
- web and social media strategy 
- content planning 
- information architecture 
- web design 
- graphic design 
- user experience 
- web architecture 
- photo editing/manipulation 
- project management  
- video editing and filming 
- usability 
- database architecture/management
